result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

treatment (Incompetency)

Judge Chris Taylor appeared in person/video. Court reporter Meredith Seymour and clerk Casee Trickel appeared in person.
03:56 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Hector Al-Homsi appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. E. L., appeared by video zoom, duly sworn and testified. Direct exam by State. Dr request filed 5/5 admitted into evidence. Cross exam by Defn. Redirect exam by State. Direct exam by CT. Recross exam by Defn. Closing argument by State. Closing argument by Defn. Defn removed from courtroom at 4:59pm for disruptive behavior, CT forfeits right to appear. CT makes findings and grants request. Amended order to treat to be signed.

records.descr: DE not competent to stand trial, case suspended

records.addlTxt: Copy of order for competency sent electronically to Dane County Conditional Release Program. Copy of minutes from CH Hrg on 4/1/22 sent electronically to DCJ.
of Commitment of Treatment (Incompetency)

10:53 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Kathleen Chung.  Galen G Strebe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statement by DE. Recess @ 10:55 am. Reconvene @ 10:59 am - all parties present.  Atty Chung - req court find DE competent.  Atty Strebe - believes DE is not competent.  Dr. C Schoenecker, duly sworn & testified by phone. Direct by Atty Strebe. Cross by Atty Chung. Re-direct by Atty Strebe. Re-cross by Atty Chung. Witness excused.  No further witnesses.  T Jefferson, DE, duly sworn & testified. Direct testimony. Direct exam by Atty Chung.  No cross.  Witness excused.  Atty Strebe req court find DE not competent & order involuntary medications.  Argument by Atty Chung.  DE removed from courtroom @ 11:29 am due to cont'd disruptions. Atty Chung objects. CT - finds DE not competent to proceed at this time, but likely to be restored to competency w/in statutory time period; order signed f/w.
Atty Kathleen Chung; reappointed
Competency hearing on April 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.
and returned.

Trial Judge - Br 12

02:41 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  The Court has reviewed the Complaint, makes a finding of probable cause and  ORDERS A COMPETENCY EVALUATION  pursuant to Wis. Stats. 971.14.  The Dept of Health & Family Services shall examine the defendant's mental competency to proceed.  Competency hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

03:20 PM Attorney Laura Breun in court.  Defendant in custody, not in court.  Benjamin Wagner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. Defendant declined to participate in scheduled Initial Appearance. Motion and argument by dismiss by Attorney Breun. Objection and argument by State. Court deferred ruling on Motion to Dismiss and rescheduled Initial Appearance.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
